ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Learned more Arabic grammar and vocabulary. Did a lot of reading and listening exercises to practice pronunciation and comprehension.
My Arabic improved substantially, I feel comfortable speaking in MSA, and my writing skills improved as well.

This course involved a lot more speaking and dialogue than L1 and L2 and this is where I made the most progress in my knowledge of arabic. I also have a better idea of how to read texts without short vowels.
I learned more about Arabic Grammar

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The class was overall really well. The structure was consistent with the syllabus so we were always prepared for class. Some days the two hours felt really long and that could be improved by either having a small break or changing up the schedule.
Not much to improve. Just hope the course was in person.

This class was A LOT of work, maybe that's the case for all summer language classes, but there was so much homework. Sometimes taking up to 7 hours to complete the work for the next day. Another weakness was that we started watching videos and asking questions in the dialect and there was little support for students who did not speak that dialect at home and only learned MSA prior to this class. The main strength was definitely the heavier focus on speaking and listening, I feel as though I built more vocabulary in this class than in L1 and L2.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend taking this course but only if you have the time. You need to dedicate a lot of time outside of class to fully understand the material and complete assignments correctly.
Yes. To anyone who is interested in learning Arabic and wants to put in the work.

narratives.question_text: The Canvas course site allowed me to identify and access required course materials easily.
